isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500, 8600 Models Built Before 05/20/2003 - FANS AND ENGINE ACCESSORIES - SNOW VALVE (ENGINE INTAKE) - FAULT DETECTION MANAGEMENT

svcproc.title: FAULT DETECTION MANAGEMENT

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems portrayed in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternative method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.

svcproc.para: A failure in the snow valve snow valve circuits will be apparent when the snow valve warning lamp doesn't illuminate when the show valve switch is on, or the lamp doesn't go out when the snow valve switch is off.
Failures in snow valve circuits could be attributed to a mechanical blockage, a blown fuse, a burned out indicator lamp, open circuits, circuits shorted to ground, or a failed module.

figure.caption: Snow Valve Circuits-Always Refer To Circuit Diagram Book For Latest Circuit Information

calloutgroup.callout1: F34 CAB FUSE BLOCK #3 (1013) IN CAB POWER DISTRIBUTION CENTER
(1002) PANEL LIGHT BUSS BAR LOCATED IN INSTRUMENT PANEL
(1003) GROUND BUSS BAR LOCATED IN INSTRUMENT PANEL
(1555) OPTIONAL WARNING LIGHT CONNECTOR LOCATED ON INSTRUMENT CLUSTER
(1901) SNOW VALVE SWITCH LOCATED ON INSTRUMENT PANEL
(4014) PASS THROUGH CONNECTOR LOCATED ON DASH PANEL ABOVE ESC
(4120) SNOW VALVE CONNECTOR LOCATED ON AIR CLEANER

table.title: Snow valve Module Wiring Harness Connector Checks

para.emph: Check with Snow Valve Harness Connector (4120) Disconnected, Ignition Key ON.

entry.para: Insure snow valve fuse F34 is not blown
Snow valve harness connector (4120) cavity C to ground.

If voltage is incorrect, check for open or short to ground in circuits between (4120) cavity C and snow valve switch (1901) terminal 3. Also check for defective switch, failed circuits to the switch from the fuse or a blown fuse.
Snow valve harness connector (4120) cavity C to D.

If voltage is incorrect, check for open or short to ground in circuits between (4120) cavity D and snow valve switch (1901) terminal 6. Also check for defective switch or failed circuits to the switch from ground buss.
Snow valve harness connector (4120) cavity A to ground.

If voltage is incorrect, check for open or short to ground in circuits between (4120) cavity A and snow valve switch (1901) terminal 7. Also check for defective switch, Burned out warning lamp, failed circuits to the switch from the fuse, or a blown fuse.
Snow valve harness connector (4120) cavity A to E.

If voltage is incorrect, check for open or short to ground in circuits between (4120) cavity E and snow valve switch (1901) terminal 4. Also check for defective switch or failed circuits to the switch from ground buss.
Snow valve harness connector (4120) cavity A to B.

If voltage is incorrect, check for open or short to ground in circuits between (4120) cavity B and snow valve switch (1901) terminal 7. Also check for defective switch, open indicator LED or failed circuits to the switch from ground buss.
If voltages check good and there is no mechanical obstructions, consider replacing the snow valve.
